Comments_List: Scientific writing, critical thinking, experiment design, literature reading, presentation skills.

How to critically evaluate experiments to form a coherent thought and to directly answer a question.
Also, how to create more direct and concise writing.
Very helpful practice and feedback on grant writing
I developed my scientific writing skills. I learned more about what goes into the grant writing process, and I learned what things to look out for when writing a grant.
Maybe at the beginning of the semester, a survey can be carried out to investigate which topics students are interested in.

The strengths were that the topics helped build off of one concept and were non-overlapping.
One downside is that 2/3 of the classes were mostly focused on HER2/HER2-like proteins.

Strengths; very valuable practice in presentation, critical reading & scientific writing.
Weaknesses; some lack of engagement from other students in discussion, & no ability to choose to present on the weeks with topics which interest you more
I will recommend it to another student. This course is challenging to be honest, but students can benefit a lot.
It's a fairly intensive class, but you quickly adapt to it and will improve you ability to plan and write.
Absolutely. Its non optional though so I guess theyre taking it anyway
Yes. The skills gained and the knowledge learned are definitely worth the work.
